body: Uncomplicated hyperparasitaemia is present in patients who have ≥ 4% parasitaemia but no signs of severity. They are at increased risk for severe malaria and for treatment failure and are considered an important source of antimalarial drug resistance.
title: 5.3.5 - Uncomplicated hyperparasitaemia
recommendation:
All cases of suspected malaria should have a parasitological test (microscopy or Rapid diagnostic test (RDT)) to confirm the diagnosis.
Both microscopy and RDTs should be supported by a quality assurance programme.
Good practice statement
